definition: to be convinced/to accept
classifier for medicine: dose/Taiwan pr. [fu2]

clothes/dress/garment/to serve (in the military, a prison sentence etc)/to obey/to be convinced (by an argument)/to convince/to admire/to acclimatize/to take (medicine)/mourning clothes/to wear mourning clothes
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: At that time, England was in a Bible war between two English translations.
sentences.chinese: 当时，英国有两版英译《圣经》，互相不服气。

sentences.english: Now, I greatly admire Tom and he was become a good friend.
sentences.chinese: 此刻，我很是服气汤姆，我们成为了好伴侣。

sentences.english: Man always can't submit to the fate, and always wants to struggle with it.
sentences.chinese: 人总是不能服气于命运，总想与它斗一斗。

sentences.english: My dear boy, I have no idea. This is, as they say, your party.
sentences.chinese: “那你认为我们是在哪儿呢？”哈利有点不服气地说。

sentences.english: However, the "and why" part of the subtitle left me unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 然而，题目中“以及为什么”的部分让我不服气。
经济学家罗伯特希勒是不服气。

sentences.english: Cupid was Apollo so say, heart unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 丘比特被阿波罗这么一说，心里很不服气。

sentences.english: Behavioral economists like Richard Thaler are unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 像理查德泰勒行为经济学家不服气。

sentences.english: I was unconvinced by the teacher's criticism.
sentences.chinese: 我对老师的批评感到不服气。

sentences.english: Is not convinced we not to speak Chinese, converses with English.
sentences.chinese: 不服气咱们不说汉语，用英文对话。

sentences.english: I hear variations on this claim a lot, but I'm unconvinced.
sentences.chinese: 我多次听到诸如此类的评价，不过很不服气。

definition: to accept wholeheartedly/to embrace/to be won over
to admire
not to accept sth/to want to have sth overruled or changed/to refuse to obey or comply/to refuse to accept as final/to remain unconvinced by/not to give in to
to have nothing to say (idiom)
not well/out of sorts/in a bad mood/without discrepancy/accurate
to have faith in/to believe in/to have confidence in/to respect
to show deference or praise publicly
to have the nerve/what a cheek!/to feel no shame/to overcome the shame/(is it) proper? (rhetorical question)
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to look down upon/to despise
to acknowledge sb as senior or superior (often in negative)/to accept (a version of events)/to buy it
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to get angry/irritated/to annoy/to aggravate/annoying
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
returning to our main topic,.../that said,.../again,.../in this connection/in passing/nevertheless,.../anyhow
